Entry.Title: Philip Green named over harassment claims
Entry.Description: The retail billionaire is named in Parliament as the man facing newspaper allegations of sexual harassment.

Entry.Title: Sir Philip Green named in Lords over harassment claims
Entry.Description: Speaking in the House of Lords, Lord Hain said it was in the public interest to reveal his name.

Entry.Title: SAS: Women allowed to join for first time
Entry.Description: Gavin Williamson says women will now be able apply for any military role, including the special forces.

Entry.Title: Suspect package found at De Niro restaurant
Entry.Description: Police investigate a package at the New York restaurant owned by the actor, the FBI says.

Entry.Title: Russian spy poisoning: Why was Sergei Skripal attacked?
Entry.Description: Evidence suggests the former spy was active across Europe, perhaps even investigating the Russian mafia.

Entry.Title: New York silicone death: Briton Donna Francis 'should be deported'
Entry.Description: Kelly Mayhew died after having cosmetic surgery injections in New York in 2015.

Entry.Title: Ed Farmer inquest: Student died from 'toxic effects' of alcohol
Entry.Description: Ed Farmer died after suffering a cardiac arrest caused by excessive alcohol, an inquest hears.

Entry.Title: Home secretary apologises for immigrant DNA tests
Entry.Description: The home secretary says people were wrongly forced to take tests to prove their right to be in the UK.

Entry.Title: Rise in women having induced labours, NHS figures show
Entry.Description: More older and overweight women giving birth is behind the trend, doctors say.

Entry.Title: 'Spider-Man' Alain Robert scales London's Heron Tower
Entry.Description: French urban climber Alain Robert climbs one of London's tallest buildings without safety gear.

Entry.Title: Man, 102, stuck on roof in Devon for three days
Entry.Description: He was rescued from the flat roof by firefighters after neighbours noticed he had not been seen.

Entry.Title: David Schwimmer: Blackpool Police identify Friends lookalike theft suspect
Entry.Description: Police say they are "overwhelmed" with the response to their social media appeal.

Entry.Title: Sainsbury's to open Oasis clothes outlets in supermarkets
Entry.Description: The supermarket hopes the High Street chain will help make it a "fashion destination".

Entry.Title: On America's trail of destruction
Entry.Description: Authorities have seized enough fentanyl to kill every American. It's a crisis that lines one major highway.

Entry.Title: Gaza protest image likened to famous Delacroix painting
Entry.Description: A striking image of a Palestinian with a flag and sling is both admired and reviled on social media.

Entry.Title: Labour's John McDonnell injures face in fall
Entry.Description: The Labour MP injured his face after tripping over some rubbish.

Entry.Title: White poppy: How is it different from the red remembrance symbol?
Entry.Description: Red, white or purple: does it matter what colour marks Remembrance Day?

Entry.Title: The clocks go back and cold weather is on its way: Some tips to help you cope
Entry.Description: Winter is coming, as the clocks go back and temperatures are set to fall. So are you prepared?

Entry.Title: Red Dead Redemption 2: A 'leap forward' for Rockstar
Entry.Description: The makers of Grand Theft Auto talk to Newsbeat about their latest project, Red Dead Redemption 2.

Entry.Title: Former Verve frontman Richard Ashcroft leaps over TV sofa
Entry.Description: Former Verve frontman surprises BBC presenters by exploring the set.

Entry.Title: The disability vehicle so tiny it couldn't take passengers
Entry.Description: For decades, disabled people in the UK were given strange, three-wheeled cars that couldn't carry passengers and were later found to be so unsafe they were taken off the road.

Entry.Title: Spectacular sunsets light up UK skies
Entry.Description: As spectacular sunsets light up the skies in the UK, we share the best snaps and explain the deep colours

Entry.Title: BBC News Channel
Entry.Description: BBC coverage of latest developments

Entry.Title: 'The food supplement that ruined my liver'
Entry.Description: Jim McCants took a food supplement to help him get healthy in middle age, but it left him in need of an urgent liver transplant.

Entry.Title: Sexually transmitted infections: What to do if you get one
Entry.Description: Don't panic - these are the steps you need to take if you have an STI.

Entry.Title: Reality Check: Which form of renewable energy is cheapest?
Entry.Description: Caroline Lucas MP says that onshore wind energy is the cheapest. What are the figures behind her claim?

Entry.Title: Letter from Africa: I was tortured in The Gambia
Entry.Description: Lamin Cham explains why he wants to testify at The Gambia's new truth and reconciliation commission.

Entry.Title: Migrant caravan: What is it and why does it matter?
Entry.Description: Thousands of migrants have been travelling by foot towards the US-Mexico border. Here's what we know.

Entry.Title: Farrokh Bulsara: The Indian heritage of Freddie Mercury
Entry.Description: Nalini Sivathasan talks to some of London's Parsi community who can't wait to see him brought back to life on screen.

Entry.Title: Fleabag star Maddie tackles a silent issue on stage
Entry.Description: Maddie Rice explains why her one-woman play is all about the importance of speaking out.

Entry.Title: Ko Ko Korina: A bad cover version, the angry minister and Spiderman too
Entry.Description: Imagine if Ed Sheeran badly covered Bohemian Rhapsody - that's akin to what just happened in Pakistan.

Entry.Title: Deep division in Brazil's north-east, where 'life is real'
Entry.Description: Brazil's poor Pernambuco state is deeply divided ahead of presidential elections on Sunday.

Entry.Title: Jamal Khashoggi murder: What is Turkey's game with Saudi Arabia?
Entry.Description: Turkey's President Erdogan has been restrained in his criticism of Saudi Arabia. Mark Lowen asks why.

Entry.Title: Pep Guardiola: The six songs that define my life, love, football and family
Entry.Description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola speaks exclusively & in depth with BBC Radio 5 live about his life, career and favourite music.

Entry.Title: Tour de France: Geraint Thomas eyes joint Team Sky lead after route unveiled
Entry.Description: Tour de France champion Geraint Thomas says he expects to be Team Sky's joint leader with Chris Froome next year following the route presentation.

Entry.Title: Kyle Edmund out of Vienna Open after losing to Fernando Verdasco in second round
Entry.Description: British number one Kyle Edmund is out of the Vienna Open after losing in the second round to Spain's Fernando Verdasco.

Entry.Title: Marcelo Brozovic: Inter Milan midfielder hides behind wall to stop Luis Suarez free-kick
Entry.Description: Inter Milan midfielder Marcelo Brozovic has an ingenious idea to stop a Luis Suarez free-kick, by lying down behind the wall... and it worked.

Entry.Title: England v New Zealand: Kallum Watkins on why you need to watch the Test series
Entry.Description: Leeds Rhinos captain Kallum Watkins gives us his reasons why the three-Test series between England and New Zealand is a must-watch.

Entry.Title: Saudi Arabia's missing princes
Entry.Description: In the last two years, three Saudi princes living in Europe have disappeared. All were critical of the Saudi government.

Entry.Title: The tip-off from a Nazi that saved my grandparents
Entry.Description: A Jewish tailor was advised to flee Denmark in 1943 by a German client. But why would this leading Nazi defy Hitler?

Entry.Title: My cheating boyfriend gave me HIV - here's how I got justice
Entry.Description: When Diane Reeve discovered that her partner was sleeping around she ended their relationship, but then she found out that he had given her HIV.
